intro: Platymiscium darienense, commonly known as the Darien beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Darien region of Panama and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive five-lobed corolla. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
